headline: Assessing Synopsys (SNPS) Valuation After Recent Share Price Pullback
summary: Why Synopsys is on investors’ radar today Synopsys (SNPS) is back in focus after recent share price moves, with the stock closing at $421.95 and showing mixed returns over the past year, month, and past 3 months. See our latest analysis for Synopsys. Recent selling pressure, including an 18.28% decline in the 1 month share price return, contrasts with a 9.23% gain over 3 months and a 3 year total shareholder return of 19.75%. This suggests longer term holders have still seen positive overall...

headline: Dow Rises as Tech Stocks Gain
summary: Stock indexes rose , led by the Nasdaq composite, while global benchmarks also gained. Several major Asian markets were closed for Lunar New Year holidays.

headline: Nvidia Sold Its Stakes in These Firms. The Stocks Are Sliding.
summary: Shares of these firms lost ground Wednesday after a filing revealed Nvidia sold off its stakes.

headline: Applied Digital, WeRide Stocks Drop After Nvidia Sells Holdings
summary: Shares in Applied Digital slid after Nvidia said it had sold its position in the AI infrastructure provider, as well as its stakes in Arm, Recursion Pharmaceuticals and WeRide.  Nvidia disclosed in a filing late Tuesday that it no longer held shares in any of the four companies as of year end.  Shares in Applied Digital and drug-discovery company Recursion both slid more than 9%.

headline: How Investors Are Reacting To Synopsys (SNPS) AI Disruption Fears Amid Chiplet Push And Ansys Deal
summary: In recent days, Synopsys, Inc. has been presenting at the Chiplet Summit 2026 in Santa Clara, showcasing its chiplet and multi-die design expertise through multiple sessions led by senior technical leaders. At the same time, the company is facing market anxiety that artificial intelligence could reshape traditional electronic design automation workflows, even as its acquisition of Ansys and the integration of SimuTech Group highlight a broader push into advanced simulation and...

headline: Arm shares edge higher as Nvidia sells entire stake in company
summary: SEC filings showed Nvidia has exited its position in the British chip designer, which it once tried to buy for $40 billion.
